title: Museo on air (RMIT TV ad)
content:
RMIT University in Melbourne uses Museo for "corporate" communication.  
And also in a [TV ad](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=UEuM-Zx5xJA&eurl=http://www.rmit.edu.au/browse;ID=a06nlcyw8hts).

<cite> </cite>

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_4813.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_6589.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3_3420.jpg)
author: Jos Buivenga

comments.content:
Nice.

Jos, I find it amusing (or perhaps intriguing) that you originally hadn't planned on making a lower case, since I've seen Museo's lower case used so often and so well.

Thank you Eric. Indeed I planned Museo as an all caps display font, but due to many requests (also on my blog), I decided that it would be better to add more versatility to it. I Must have done something well, because most of the times I myself am surpised by how nice it looks. :-)

BTW the video looks blurry. With this [simple Youtube hack](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=OekRUCChCd4&fmt=18) I came across  
it does makes a difference. Here's the new \* [link](http://web.archive.org/web/20120727003011/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=UEuM-Zx5xJA&eurl=http://www.rmit.edu.au/browse;ID=a06nlcyw8hts&fmt=18)\*.

Seriously one of my favorites. I find myself wanting to use it for everything.

Congratulations on the success.
That's a great compliment! Thanks Katherine.
